result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant received copy of information on both cases.

3:17 PM Defendant Vang Xiong in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Vang Xiong.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler appears on behalf of Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF235 & 22CF303.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Court appoints Atty Kryshak as court appointed counsel since the public defender has been unable to get an attorney and there is a conflict with Atty McFarland.
Atty Kryshak will let the court know if he has any conflicts to represent the defendant.

Initial Appearance set for June 13, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. n Br 2

11:13 AM Defendant Vang Xiong appeared by video.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI. Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for the Defendant Vang Xiong.
Court calls the case.
Atty Dodge states the appearances. 

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of possession of methamphetamine, felony bail jumping, possession of drug paraphernalia. 
Atty Dodge does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Do not knowingly associate with persons possessing or consuming controlled substances
Remain absolutely sober as to controlled substances
Cooperate with Justice Point Program, Comply with assessments and reporting requirements
